page.title: 19FARMING IN MIDDLETON
page.content: There are several farms on the outskirts of the town. The average size is 50 acres. Production is mainly {dairy}with herds of about 1 cow per acre, the main breeds being British Fresian with a few Ayrshire. Home produced feed is mainly silage, with small scale hay production, which is too dependent on the weather. {Beef}production has increased since the E.E.C. sponsored a move away from dairy farming. This is mainly intensive indoor production of British Fresian, Hereford, Charolais & Aberdeen Angus. {Poultry}production is very small scale owing to pressure from massive "factory farms" about the country. {Pigs}are bred on small farms but "finishing" is done at large-scale centres. Very little{crop-farming}is done.
